page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: All children from Elham and some from surrounding areas came to the old Elham school. In December of 1969 the new school was completed and an extension was finished in 1975. Some money from the Sir John Williams hall still provides help for the new school and other eductional societies. The school provides excellent educational facilities for the 86 pupils. In the last few years the school has achieved considerable success in local music competitions under tutition from a Kent School of Music teacher. The Violin and Recorder are the most popular. The secondary schools are in Folkestone and Hythe. Now the John Wiiliams hall is used for a pre-school playgroup and Piano lessons are given by Lady Douglas.
